item.title: Nikki add a quote by Elizabeth Wurtzel
item.description: "Insanity is knowing that what you're doing is completely idiotic, but still, somehow, you just can't stop it." -- Elizabeth Wurtzel

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in life. And I am horribly limited." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Life has been some combination of fairy-tale coincidence and joie de vivre and shocks of beauty together with some hurtful self-questioning." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Moli
item.description: "Writing is like prostitution. First you do it for love, and then for a few close friends, and then for money." -- Moli

item.title: Nikki add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength." -- George Orwell

item.title: Nikki add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Doublethink means the power of holding two contradictory beliefs in one's mind simultaneously, and accepting both of them." -- George Orwell

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Courtney Love
item.description: "The language of love letters is the same as suicide notes." -- Courtney Love

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Watch out for intellect, because it knows so much it knows nothing and leaves you hanging upside down, mouthing knowledge as your heart falls out of your mouth." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "I am too intelligent, too demanding, and too resourceful for anyone to be able to take charge of me entirely. No one knows me or loves me completely. I have only myself" -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Andrei Tarkovsky
item.description: "A man writes because he is tormented, because he doubts. He needs to constantly prove to himself and the others that he’s worth something. And if I know for sure that I’m a genius? Why write then? What the hell for?" -- Andrei Tarkovsky

item.title: Nikki add a quote by Phyllis Chesler
item.description: "Ideal mental health, like freedom, exists for one person only if it exists for all people." -- Phyllis Chesler
